channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+3000] Mind Blowing Hyperrealistic Sculptures [Pics]
item.description: Artists that produce photorealistic sculptures, for the most part, aim to show us our bodies and life as it really is.

item.title: [+1839] Teaching of evolution to become mandatory in England
item.description: Primary school children in England will have to learn about evolution under a shake-up of the national curriculum. Schools Minister Vernon Coaker says the subject will be a compulsory elements of a new primary school curriculum being introduced in 2011. Scientists and humanists had lobbied ministers for the inclusion of evolution.

item.title: [+1384] Refusal to pay forced gratuity - GO TO JAIL.
item.description: Couple Busted for Refusing to Pay Tip: Happy hour ends with handcuffs when they won't pay a $16 tip for terrible service.

item.title: [+1260] Depressed woman loses benefits over Facebook photos
item.description: A Quebec woman on long-term sick leave is fighting to have her benefits reinstated after her employer's insurance company cut them, she says, because of photos posted on Facebook.

item.title: [+1196] Texas accidentally 'bans' straight-marriage - THE WEEK
item.description: A 2005 state constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage and civil unions eliminates marriage in Texas, according to Democratic attorney general candidate Barbara Ann

item.title: [+1152] Steve Jobs is a man of a few words
item.description: Steve Jobs doesn't email Apple customers often, but when he does, his responses are always short and to the point

item.title: [+1101] $375 FINE MIN...wait what? [PIC]
[+992] Utah Senator doesn’t want gays “stuffing it down his throat”
item.description: In something of a positive step for the gay person in Utah, Utah senator Chris Buttars has said he might support a bill giving gay people equal rights for jobs and non-marriage related things. His word phrasing of not wanting gays “stuffing it down [his] throat all the time and certainly in [his] kid’s face” leaves something to be desired.

item.title: [+859] Google PC will start in seven seconds or less
item.description: New Google Inc software will start up a computer as fast as a television can be turned on, the search company said on Thursday as it showed off its Chrome operating system designed for PCs.

item.title: [+859] Microsoft denies it built 'backdoor' in Windows 7
item.description: Microsoft today denied that it has built a backdoor into Windows 7, a concern that surfaced on Wednesday after a senior National Security Agency (NSA) official testified before Congress that the agency had worked on the operating system.

item.title: [+829] Sarah Palin Flees Book Signing, Wingnuts Yell At Leaving Bus
item.description: Angry crowd shouts at Sarah Palin at her book signing in Noblesville, Indiana on November 19, 2009 after Palin quits and refuses to sign books for around 300 families that spent about 3+ hours waiting in line.

item.title: [+580] 8 Things You Need to Know about Chrome OS
item.description: Google pulled the wraps off of Chrome OS today. You can expect to see Chrome ship in about a year, and showed the first glimpses of the new OS, details about the architecture, the hardware it will run on, and gave us the first hints about what the Google Cloud OS will really look like.

item.title: [+572] Worried pimp called off Rabbi's three-day drug-fuelled orgy
item.description: An eminent rabbi was so exhausted after three days of constant cocaine-fuelled partying with escorts that his pimp grew worried and cancelled that day’s supply of girls, a jury was told.

item.title: [+563] Disneyland Made Out Of Legos (Pics)
item.description: Using the Lego bricks you can make the souvenir stands, ride replicas and even the various people you would wish to meet during your Disneyland tour.

item.title: [+520] The Simpsons' Moe Szyslak's Most Quotable Moments
item.description: Springfield's pug fugliest bartender is also one of its most eloquent citizens.

item.title: [+519] Florida Man To Smoke 115,000th Joint, Sets Guinness Record
item.description: When you think of the world's most prolific pot smokers, certain names come to mind: Snoop, Cheech & Chong, Willie Nelson. How about Irvin Rosenfeld? The 56-year-old Ft Lauderdale stockbroker will put his name among the greats when he sets a world record tomorrow for weed consumption while lighting up his 115,000th joint. Best part? It's all legal.

item.title: [+504] Class Action Lawsuit Over Xbox Live Bannings
item.description: Boutique law firm AbingtonIP is "investigating" what it considers the "convenient" recent Xbox Live bannings. The firm posits that the "tens of thousands" of banned Xbox Live subscribers who used modded consoles deserve recompense due to the timing of the action.

item.title: [+497] Every Part of the Buffalo [Comic]
[+488] Hockey Goal of The Year, I'm Calling It (Video)
item.description: Steven Stamkos proved that you don't need to be on your skates to score. If the 2010 Winter Olympics see a goal this amazing, then the Games will be truly blessed.

item.title: [+484] Looking Back at the Left 4 Dead 2 Boycott
item.description: For four-and-a-half months, upwards of 40,000 gamers took part in one of the most visible protests in the industry's history. Where did they succeed and where did they fail?
